You dont have to download it, There is an option for Testdrive on the page you can try it out in your browser

I tried it, but it was running slow on my computer (using the testdrive). It is also possible to run it from a virtual machine, using just the .iso file.

As far as my opinions on it, is it just a Suse version with Gnome and some other packages? It seemed to work fine, although no advance button appeared at the time zone setting page in the setup. Other than that, I do not have too much to say. What are you planning to do with it?

> As far as my opinions on it, is it just a Suse version with Gnome and some other packages? It seemed to work fine, although no advance button appeared at the time zone setting page in the setup. Other than that, I do not have too much to say. What are you planning to do with it?

I was just thinking that i could make a operating system using a standard Desktop environment but light software, So that you can burn it to a dvd and use it when you need it.

I dont reccomend installing it though as it has insufficient drivers to make it usefull for average use.
